HERE‚ÄôS WHERE I STAND ON $PLTR NOW THAT THE MARKET IS PRICING IT AT 180x EBITDA

1. AIP IS THE NEW CUDA
The market isn‚Äôt paying for a product. It‚Äôs paying for embedded positioning. AIP sits inside mission-critical workflows -- defense targeting systems, fraud detection, hospital ops -- where latency is life-or-death and switching is impossible. Like CUDA for $NVDA, AIP becomes the system every enterprise builds around.

2. PALANTIR IS SOLVING THE HARDEST PART OF AI: DEPLOYMENT
Anyone can plug into an LLM. Almost no one can operationalize it at scale -- especially in regulated industries. AIP handles compliance, orchestration, and data trust out of the box -- that‚Äôs a choke point on the AI economy.

3. AIP IS A GATEWAY TO INSIGHT MONETIZATION
Jensen Huang says AI infra spend could hit $100T. Palantir‚Äôs upside isn‚Äôt just selling software -- it‚Äôs seeing where that capital flows. AIP sits at the decision layer across industries, giving Palantir early, actionable insight into what‚Äôs working. That unlocks a second engine: monetizing intelligence, backing emerging applications, and compounding equity -- part SaaS, part hedge fund.

Q to Powell: Taylor rules say you should be looking through this.

Powell: That's right.

Q: So why aren't you cutting rates?

Powell: Taylor rules say we're right where we should be. And one of them shows rates should actually be higher.

Long-term research indicates US 10 year has traded at CPI plus 175.

With inflation at 2.5% that puts a 10 year at 4.25% or so.

That was history ‚Äî but deficits/ensuing supply of bonds/and a weak dollar should keep CPI from falling below 2.5% and the 10 year from falling below 4.25%.

Stocks are AI dominated and continue to suggest 1-2% economic growth despite tariffs and geopolitical unrest.

I suggest a ‚Äúlittle bull market‚Äù for stocks and a ‚Äúlittle bear market‚Äù for bonds.

Nothing dramatic either way for now.
The S&P 500 is now less than 1% from its February 19 all-time high of 6,144.

Where things stand, after Powell's written testimony has been released and before the Q&A starts.

tl:dr, Trump appointees Waller and Bowman are suggesting a July cut. Powell is reiterating "no."
Will the July FOMC meeting see at least two dissenters?

Effectively, it's a bet that the ceasefire will hold through July.

Bettors are optimistic that it will hold.
---
Remember, we view betting markets as the summation of all understanding of an issue distilled into one probability.  It's what we think is going to happen, not what will happen.

It's like asking an expert for their best estimate. Can it be wrong? Yes, but no more so than experts on TV. But this expert is far more objective. Bettors want to be right because that is how they make money, not make political statements.

As new information becomes available, these bettors will adjust their outlook.

From @biancoresearch: "Are we witnessing the BEGINNING of a Fed mutiny, led by two Trump appointees, Bowman and Waller, & driven by Trump's persistent demands for rate cuts? Will Powell squash dissenters? Does this type of mutiny (Fed style) give Trump an opening to fire Powell?"

McCullough: Gold Back on Radar as Dollar Declines

üîä

After an epic bullish run in owning gold for much of 2024 - and then selling it on time in 2025 - Hedgeye CEO @KeithMcCullough is watching the signals closely for an opportunity to catch the next up move.

‚ÄúWe buy things when they‚Äôre on sale,‚Äù McCullough said Tuesday's Macro Show. 

‚ÄúNot chasing at the highs‚Äîbuying with process, with patience.‚Äù

One major signal is the continued breakdown of the $USD, driven by the prospect of Jerome Powell‚Äôs potential replacement pledging rate cuts‚Äîdespite rising inflation. 

This loss of monetary credibility could be disastrous for the dollar and may serve as the next big catalyst for gold.

"That's the USA losing credibility," McCullough says referring to the chart of the dollar. "

"[Fed member Christopher] Waller wants rate cuts, even when inflation and growth say otherwise.‚Äù

If I had to start over, this is what I'd focus on.

4 Steps to Boost Your P&L by Being "LESS BAD"

Step 1: Crunch Those Numbers

Put all your trade data into a spreadsheet.

Step 2: Spot the Leaks

Look for the common threads. Are you selling winners too soon? Violating your daily loss limit?

Step 3: Break One Account-Draining Habit

Pick one money-draining mistake and squash it. Cutting ‚Äúunforced errors‚Äù is the fastest way to stack cash.

Step 4: Rinse, Repeat, and Win!

Every $10K in mistakes you fix adds $10K to your account. Get less bad before you try to get better!
